channel.title: Portforwarding question
channel.description:
i had a question.. i have two laptops in the same house under the same internet connection.
i wanted to know if i can open a port on one computer ( so basicly portfoward on one computer ) then have the source always running on the other computer.
is this possible?
the only reason i want to do this is because my windows vista home basic (the one i want always running the source) doesent allow me to open firewall settings so i dident know if that be a problem.

item.title: Portforwarding question
item.dc:creator: @ChatX2012 ChatX2012
item.description:
@ChatX2012 wrote:

It is actually possible, Im hosting from one laptop and running it on the other with no vps and it works

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding question
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

no this is not possible unless you bought a vps. If you portforward from one of your computers then the source files would have to be on the computer that was portforward so it allows incoming connections/ makes it online. In addition, putting the source files on the other computer (one not portforward) will cause the server to be offline because it is no use.

Read full topic

item.title: Portforwarding question
item.dc:creator: @Project-Xml Project-Xml
item.description:
@Project-Xml wrote:

Once you have got a successful port open it should work. I would be fascinated to know if it does. So post back once you’ve tried.

Read full topic

item.description:
@PvPXile wrote:

Try it. It may actually work. If it doesnt set an exception on the firewall on your hosting machine.
